business.headline: Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.
Sensex closes 123 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 123.42 points to end at 82,515.14, while the NSE Nifty gained 37.15 points to close at 25,141.40.

Bharat rising: Why Tier-2 cities drive job growth, explains HireVeda co-founderWhile the metros still lead in the number of jobs, the speed of growth in smaller cities is hard to ignore, noted co-founder of HireVeda and ExecEdge.

India now home to over 85,000 millionaires, ranks 4th globally: ReportIndia now trails only the United States, China, and Japan in terms of the number of wealthy individuals, accounting for 3.7% of the global HNWI population.

Digital Form 16: Step-by-step guide to download and use it for easy ITR filingWith the advent of digital platforms, accessing and using Form 16 has become more straightforward, making it a vital document for accurate and hassle-free income tax return (ITR) filing.

Chasing Rs 10 discounts? CA explains why tracking every rupee isn't making you richIt's a common belief that managing every rupee wisely equals financial discipline. People cut back on little indulgences and chase discounts, feeling financially in control, yet, their money may be slipping away in unnoticed ways.

'Make in India' gave us breakthrough in defence, says Bharat Forge's Baba Kalyani"A lot of army guys walked by, some laughed at it," Chairman Baba Kalyani said during an episode of the New India Junction podcast  "Not a single guy stopped to even see what the hell it was."

Paramount to cut 3.5% of US jobs as cable TV declines: ReportThis is not the first round of job losses at Paramount. Back in August last year, the company had already cut 15% of its workforce, indicating ongoing adjustments in response to market changes.

Law tribunal clears merger of Inox Wind Energy Limited with Inox WindThe merger is expected to reduce liabilities by around Rs 2,050 crore. The company also expects to save costs by improving how resources are used and by simplifying various processes.
Sensex opens 86 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 104.24 points to 82,495.96, while the NSE Nifty50 added 36.70 points to 25,140.95 as of 9:31 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO to open soon with Rs 1,387 crore target. Check detailsOswal Pumps is launching an IPO aiming to raise Rs 1,387.34 crore. Here are essential details potential investors need to consider before subscribing.

Tariff cuts, easing digital barriers: India, US make headway in trade talksBoth nations are aiming for an interim trade pact by the end of June, before the pause on Trump's proposed tariffs expires. India is advocating for full exemption from a 26% reciprocal tariff on domestic goods.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty open higher today? Check key levelsSensex and Nifty closed flat on Tuesday, ending a four-day winning streak. The flat close was largely due to profit booking, especially in financial stocks.
Stocks to watch on June 11: Wipro, Reliance Infra, IndiGo, Maruti SuzukiExperts suggest that the positive sentiment is likely to persist on Dalal Street with the key support level of Nifty at 24,850.

World Bank slashes global growth forecast, cites higher tariffs and uncertaintyIn its twice-yearly Global Economic Prospects report, the bank lowered its forecasts for nearly 70 per cent of all economies as well as six emerging market regions, from the levels it projected just six months ago before US President Donald Trump took office.

Applying for a personal loan? How many years of ITRs do you needBanks need to be sure you can pay back the money you borrow. For salaried individuals, a regular pay cheque and Form 16 usually provide enough assurance. However, for self-employed individuals, ITRs over several years give a more consistent and reliable picture of earnings and financial health.
Raymond Realty likely to list in early July, says chairman Gautam SinghaniaEach shareholder will receive one share of Raymond Realty for every share held in Raymond, the group said previously.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as profit booking halts rally; IT gains capped by banksThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 53.49 points to end at 82,391.72, while the NSE Nifty50 ended flat with a gain of 1 point to 25,104.25.

Mutual fund inflows fall: Should beginners still trust SIPs or go for stocks?Data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) shows that net inflows into equity schemes dropped 22% month-on-month to Rs 19,013 crore in May, marking the fifth straight month of decline and the weakest level since April 2024.

India emerges as Apple's new bet, but China and Trump raise red flags: ReportLast week, Foxconn announced a fresh $1.5 billion investment in its Indian operations, offering some reassurance to officials in New Delhi. This move may ease tensions in New Delhi that began when Donald Trump publicly stated he told Tim Cook not to expand Apple's manufacturing in India, casting doubt on hopes that most iPhones for the US would be made in India by 2026.
Filing under old tax regime? New ITR rules you should know in 2025Key changes in the Income Tax Return (ITR) filing process for those opting for the old tax regime in the Assessment Year 2025–26.

Rupee stuck in neutral as Asia's currencies race ahead on weak dollarWhile the Singapore dollar, Korean won, and Taiwanese dollar have jumped between 6% and 9.5% so far this year, the rupee has barely moved.

Mutual fund SIPs continue strong run, touch Rs 26,688 crore in May: AMFIMutual fund SIPs reached a fresh high of Rs 26,688 crore in May, inching up from Rs 26,632 crore the previous month, as per AMFI data released on June 10.

RCB to get new owner? Diageo looking for stake sale, says reportDiageo Plc, the British company that owns RCB through its Indian arm United Spirits Ltd., is exploring options to sell a part or all of its stake in the franchise.

Planning to pay 0 tax by setting up in Dubai? Coinswitch co-founder calls it a trapStarting a company in Dubai sounds appealing with no income tax and easy formalities. But if you operate from India, authorities might still consider it an Indian firm. Here's why.

Lilavati Trust hits back at HDFC Bank, rejects outstanding duesIn a sharply worded statement issued Monday, the Trust asserted that neither it nor its permanent trustee Prashant Kishor Mehta has ever borrowed from HDFC Bank.

Paras Defence shares in focus today, rise over 1% in early trade. Here's whyAlongside the 1:2 stock split, Paras Defence also declared its first-ever dividend of Rs 0.50 per share during its Q4 FY25 earnings on April 30. The announcement came on the back of a strong financial performance for the quarter.

Bengaluru's PG crisis: What's behind the mass shutdowns?Once the lifeline for Bengaluru's migrant workforce, why are PGs now vanishing from the city's tech hubs at an alarming pace? Read on know why hundreds of PG accommodations have shut down in the city.
Sensex, Nifty extend gains at open but lose steam as profit booking sets inThe S&P BSE Sensex added 68.34 points to 82,513.55, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 19.40 points to 25,128.05 as of 9:25 am.
Hiring plans steady in India Inc for Q3 FY25: ReportIndia ranked second globally, behind the UAE, which reported the strongest hiring sentiment. India reported a Net Employment Outlook (NEO) of 42%.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyThe Sensex and Nifty are likely to extend their gains, helped by improving hopes around global trade discussions and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) policy measures.

Stocks to watch on June 10: Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Motilal Oswal, Premier EnergiesSensex and Nifty rose nearly half a percent in the last session, driven by favourable trends in both domestic and global markets.

Rs 33,000 per device, Rs 3,000 monthly post-trial: Starlink's India entry planStarlink customers will need to purchase a satellite dish-essential hardware for accessing the service-at an estimated cost of Rs 33,000. The monthly unlimited data plan will be offered at Rs 3,000.

Warner Bros Discovery to become two separate companies: ReportThe decision comes as more people stop watching traditional TV and move to streaming platforms. This shift has forced many media companies to rethink how they work.

Your Rs 1 crore flat is now Rs 90 lakh: Investor explains why value is shrinkingA financial influencer warns that unchecked money printing and currency devaluation could be reducing the real value of properties and other assets, urging investments in inflation-resistant assets.

Pakistan's economy set to grow 2.7% in FY25: ReportPakistan's central bank, in a bid to encourage growth, cut its policy rate by more than 1,000 basis points in the current fiscal year. Its latest cut last month brought the key rate to 11%, resuming an easing cycle that had brought rates down from 22% after a brief pause in March.
Sensex settles over 200 points; Nifty above 25,100; Kotak Bank gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 256.22 points to close at 82,445.21, while the NSE Nifty50 added 100.20 points to end at 25,103.20.

Who is Sashidhar Jagdishan? HDFC Bank CEO under financial fraud lensSashidhar Jagdishan has been a part of HDFC Bank since 1996. He joined as a manager in the finance division and quickly rose through the ranks.

Shein, Reliance aim to sell India-made clothes globally within a year: ReportThe aim is to make Shein-branded clothes in India not just for local sales but also for international markets, starting with the US and UK, within the next 6 to 12 months.
Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in FY25: Who earned more than him?Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in the financial year 2024–25, which is much less than several leading business heads in India.

entertainment.headline: Rupali Ganguly reacts with pride after PM Modi talks menstrual hygieneRupali Ganguly has expressed her admiration for PM Narendra Modi's efforts in breaking menstrual taboos. She feels proud of the positive impact this initiative has on society and awareness.

Mark Ruffalo dedicates poetic anniversary post to wife: My love, partner and friendActor Mark Ruffalo recently wrote a romantic note for his wife Sunrise Coigney on social media. He shared a series of pictures with Sunrise, while cherishing their 25th wedding anniversary.

We have to be feared: Goldy Brar justifies shooting at AP Dhillon's Canada homeGangster Goldy Brar reacted to the 2024 shooting outside singer AP Dhillon's Canada residence. In a documentary, Brar justified the incident, and said thousands of families are dependent on his gang.

Avika Gor engaged to boyfriend Milind Chandwani in filmy, magical ceremonyActor Avika Gor has announced her engagement to 'MTV Roadies Real Heroes' fame Milind Chandwani through Instagram. The couple has been together for over five years.

Sidhu Moose Wala's 3 unreleased songs out on his birth anniversary, go viralThree new tracks by the late Punjabi rapper Sidhu Moose Wala went viral within hours of its release on YouTube and Spotify. The tracks were released to mark his birth anniversary on June 11.

BTS V back on Instagram after military discharge, shares throwback picsA day after being discharged from mandatory military service, BTS' V treated his fans with a bunch of throwback pictures from his time. BTS' RM, Jungkook, V and Jimin were officially discharged from the services.

Blake Lively slams manufactured shame against women after Baldoni lawsuit dismissalActor Blake Lively recently highlighted the manufactured shame and emotional toll women have to endure after her win over Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against her.

Jr NTR begins dubbing for 'War 2', his action film with Hrithik RoshanJr NTR has officially begun dubbing for his much-anticipated Bollywood film, 'War 2'. The film, which also stars Hrithik Roshan and Kiara Advani, is slated for release on August 14.

Actor Jason Isaacs reacts to Tom Felton's return as Draco in Broadway's Harry PotterActor Tom Felton is set to reprise his role as Draco Malfoy on Broadway starting November 11. Jason Isaacs, who played his on-screen father Lucius in the film franchise, reacted to his return in the Harry Potter play.

Parth Samthaan shares pics with CID 2 team as he bids farewell to the showActor Parth Samthaan shared a bunch of pictures from CID 2 set as he bid farewell to the show. He had replaced actor Shivaji Satam as ACP Ayushman.

Nandamuri Balakrishna's knife flip goes viral from his 65th birthday bashActor and MLA Nandamuri Balakrishna celebrated his 65th birthday on June 10 with massive fanfare across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. The actor warmly interacted with fans who gathered to celebrate his birthday, posing for selfies.

Panchayat 4 trailer reactions: Fans say life is good againFans gave a thumbs up to the trailer of 'Panchayat Season 4', which was released by the makers on June 11.  The social media users expressed their excitement and shared how they couldn't wait any longer for the series.

Kesari Chapter 2 on OTT: When and where to watch Akshay Kumar's courtroom dramaAkshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' is set to stream on Jio Hotstar from June 13. The film also stars R Madhavan and Ananya Panday in key roles.

Housefull 5 turns animal cruelty into comedy, and it's uglyIn 'Housefull 5', a digitally-created parrot is relentlessly thrashed and beaten for cheap laughs. But when did beating a parrot become a joke? When did we decide that it was funny?

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 to premiere on July 3: Reports'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' will reportedly premiere on July 3. The show's first episode aired on the same day 25 years ago. Ekta Kapoor's father Jeetendra is also likely to make an appearance in the sequel.

Rahul Vaidya says Virat Kohli's brother called him after Instagram controversySinger Rahul Vaidya shared that Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas Kohli, contacted him after his controversial remarks involving the cricketer. Vikas advised Rahul to focus on his singing instead of seeking publicity through Virat's name.

Rapper Kanye West renames himself from Ye to Ye Ye: ReportRapper Kanye West, popularly known as Ye, has updated his legal name. He will now be referred to as 'Ye Ye', as per his name in the new California business filings.

Did Shilpa Shetty scream at a tourist in Croatia? Raj Kundra reacts to viral videoActor Shilpa Shetty and her family were involved in an argument at a restaurant in Croatia after their reserved table was given to someone else. The video has since gone viral. Her husband, Raj Kundra, explained that the incident spoiled Shilpa's birthday celebration.

Let Her Go singer Passenger announces 3-city India tour. DetailsEnglish singer-songwriter Passenger is making his much-awaited India debut this year. The 'Let Her Go' hitmaker announced a three-city tour in November.

general news.headline: Rare minerals to us, college admissions to them: Trump's done deal with ChinaWith this deal, Beijing will supply magnets and rare earth minerals to the US while the latter will allow Chinese students in its colleges and universities.

Sonam admits to plotting honeymoon murder, breaks down before cops: SourcesSonam Raghuvanshi confessed to hatching a plan to get her husband killed with the help of her alleged lover Raj Kushwaha, who, too, confessed to the crime a day before.

It'll come back to haunt you: S Jaishankar warns West over Pak-backed terrorExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the global response to the recent Pahalgam terror attack in Kashmir and said terrorism will come back to haunt the West.

Zohran Mamdani turns New York City mayoral race into Bollywood blockbusterZohran Mamdani has leaned into his South Asian heritage and captured the attention of younger, immigrant, and working-class New Yorkers with his populist platform and savvy use of Hindi film nostalgia.

Can relationships be taught as a curriculum in a classroom?Delhi University (DU) has launched a course that will cover everything from understanding love and friendships to spotting red flags and building healthier bonds. The question is: Can relationships be taught as a curriculum in a classroom?

WTC Final 2025 Day 1: Webster leads fightback with 50, Tea calledAustralia vs South Africa Live Score, World Test Championship Final 2025 Updates: Beau Webster has completed a turnaround fifty after his shaky start with the bat, and Australia have made a strong return to good runflow. South Africa's bowling attack had found very little to trouble the Australia batters ahead of Tea.

Moose Wala made unforgivable mistakes: Goldy Brar on hip-hop star's murder In an interview with the BBC World Service, gangster Goldy Brar justified the killing, saying Moose Wala had committed "unforgivable" mistakes.

Indian student handcuffed, pinned down at airport had entered US illegallyAn Indian man from Haryana, who entered the US illegally, was being deported when he was restrained at Newark Airport due to unfit behaviour for travel, the official sources said.
What happens when you cut sugar from your diet for 30 daysCan a 30-day sugar break improve physical and mental health? Here's what experts say.

Visual story: How Meghalaya honeymoon murder unfoldedWith each passing day, new information related to the case comes into the public eye, and sometimes it contradicts what was previously known about the chilling case.

Pakistan scales up defence budget, but who is really fuelling it?Pakistan, in its FY2026 Budget, has increased defence expenditure by 20, the largest hike in decades. This comes after setbacks from Indian strikes during Operation Sindoor and the shelving of projects worth PKR 1,000 billion. But with limited foreign exchange reserves and massive debt, how is Pakistan funding its military, and who is backing it?

Parde mein rehne do: Pakistan's cover-up operation after Sindoor strikesFresh high-resolution satellite images analysed by India Today show Pakistan is now using tarpaulins to cover at least three military sites hit during India's Operation Sindoor.
Why can some students memorise anything? Science has the answerRote memory isn't a gift, it's a brain game and not everyone is wired the same way. Science is here to tell you why.

Trump can't broker peace between his ego and reality, forget about India-Pak ceasefireFrom his trade war dud against China to burning his fingers in the Ukraine-Russia war to his fake claims of brokering India-Pak ceasefire to stoking fire in Los Angeles, it's a global Donald Trump clown show in the White House. And we are running out of patience and popcorn.

Don't even drink Royal Challenge: DK Shivakumar denies rumours of buying RCBKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has denied rumours of buying the RCB franchise, saying he has no time for it. His clarification comes after 11 people died in a stampede at an RCB event. Shivakumar even joked, "I don't even drink Royal Challenge."

Watch: Lalu Yadav cuts humongous cake of laddoos with sword on 78th birthdayFormer Bihar Chief Minister and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) president Lalu Prasad Yadav turned 78 on Wednesday. He made the occasion a special one by cutting a 78-kg cake made of laddoos at his Patna residence.

Panchayat 4 trailer reactions: Fans say life is good againFans gave a thumbs up to the trailer of 'Panchayat Season 4', which was released by the makers on June 11.  The social media users expressed their excitement and shared how they couldn't wait any longer for the series.

Man hugs, kisses women out on walk in Bengaluru park; dares them to report himA man allegedly assaulted two women near Milton Park in Bengaluru, triggering safety concerns. Police have registered a case under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and begun investigation.
When will Ax-4 Mission with India's Shubhanshu Shukla launch?The mission which was supposed to launch on May 29 has seen repeated delays until Wednesday due to weather and technical issues.

Video: Have mercy, mother appeals to another on live TV in honeymoon murder caseAs the Meghalaya honeymoon murder probe deepens, an emotional face-off unfolded on India Today between the mothers of the accused and the victim, laying personal grief, blame, and a demand for justice.
Strawberry Moon to rise tonight: Don't miss watching it for this reasonThe moon will appear slightly larger and brighter due to its proximity to perigee — the point in its orbit closest to Earth.

100% sure she did it: Sonam's brother blames her for Meghalaya honeymoon murderSonam's brother, who spoke to reporters in Indore after meeting Raja's mother, said while she hasn't confessed to the murder, the evidence that has emerged so far points to her direct involvement.

Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.

sports.headline: WTC Final: Steve Smith goes past Gary Sobers to script Test record at Lord'sSteve Smith became the visiting batter to score the most runs in Tests at Lord's on Wednesday when he reached 51 runs on Day 1 of the World Test Championship final against South Africa.

Video: Kyle Verreynne takes stunning one-handed catch to dismiss Travis HeadSouth Africa dominated the morning session of the World Test Championship final against Australia at Lord's. Wicketkeeper Kyle Verreynne took a sensational catch to deny Travis Head a counterpunch on Day 1 in London.

Suryakumar Yadav drops to sixth, Adil Rashid roars to no. 2India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has slipped out of the top five in the latest ICC Men's T20I Rankings for batters. On the other hand, England leg-spinner Adil Rashid has climbed to No. 2 in the bowling rankings.

Watch: D Gukesh picks his favourite meme on viral Magnus Carles outburstD Gukesh couldn't stop laughing as he reacted to hilarious viral memes about Magnus Carlsen's dramatic table slam — even picking his personal favourites in a ChessBase India interview that delighted fans online.

How to manage Bumrah's workload in England? Ganguly gives key adviceSourav Ganguly warned the Indian team from overworking Jasprit Bumrah and advised them to limit his workload during the England tour. Bumrah carried the bulk of the load during the Australia tour, which forced him out of action due to a back issue.

ICC Chairman Jay Shah rings Lord's bell to kick off ultimate Test battleICC chairman Jay Shah rang the iconic Lord's bell to mark the start of the World Test Championship final. South Africa seized early advantage, bowling first, putting Australia under pressure on day one.

Dressing room seems like a funeral, but India can still qualify: Coach MarquezIndian football head coach Manolo Marquez described the mood in the dressing room as "a funeral" after his side's crushing last-minute 0-1 defeat to Hong Kong in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers.

Carlo Ancelotti ready to look forward as Brazil qualify for World CupCarlo Ancelotti said that he is ready to look forward as Brazil qualified for the FIFA World Cup 2026 with a 1-0 win over Paraguay. Ancelotti secured his first win as the manager of the Brazilian national team.

Carlos Alcaraz unwinds in Ibiza amid doubts over Wimbledon tune-up participationCarlos Alcaraz headed Ibiza for a much-needed break after his French Open victory. His upcoming participation at Queen's Club, an ATP 500 tournament in London, remains uncertain.

City seal four CWC signings: Reijnders, Cherki, Ait-Nouri, BettinelliAfter a rare trophyless season, Manchester City have swiftly revamped their squad with four crucial signings ahead of the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup, aiming to reassert their dominance on the global stage.

Kalyan Chaubey destroyed Indian football: Bhaichung Bhutia demands overhaulFormer India captain Bhaichung Bhutia has accused the Indian football federation of destroying the sport after India suffered a 1-0 defeat against Hong Kong at Kowloon's Kai Tak Sports Park.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
